intro: Ervatamia siamensis, commonly known as Siam ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
